intro: Pandanus borbonicus, commonly known as the Madagascar pandanus, is a tropical plant native to the island of Madagascar. It is a member of the Pandanaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and long, narrow leaves that are often used in traditional crafts. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically grouped in clusters at the tips of the leaves. Its leaves are also used in cooking, particularly in the preparation of certain local dishes. The plant thrives in humid, coastal environments and is well adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat.
